Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the proposed ballot measure by suggesting that it will eliminate all parts of Prop. 13 and cause property taxes to skyrocket for everyone, when in reality it only applies to commercial and industrial properties.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that the proposed ballot measure specifically exempts residential properties, agricultural properties, and owners of commercial and industrial properties with a combined value of $3 million or less.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the assertion that California's Attorney General, Xavier Becerra, is actively putting together plans to raise property tax revenue.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the elimination of Prop. 13's tax protections for commercial and industrial properties will automatically lead to skyrocketing property taxes for all individuals, without considering alternative explanations or potential impacts.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or acknowledge the arguments made by supporters of the proposed ballot measure, who argue that the initiative is necessary to fund schools and local communities while protecting residential properties.
